briefdescription.para: Constructor.
Constructor in which the LinkIndex to which the joint is attached are not specified.

detaileddescription.para: This constructor is typically used together with the Model::addJoint or Model::addJointAndLink methods, in which the links to which the joint is attached are specified by the other arguments of the method.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.
Destructor.
Clone the joint object.
Set the two links at which the joint is attached.
Set the transform between the link2 frame and link1 frame at joint position 0 (or at the identity configuration element for complex joints).

detaileddescription.para: The link1_T_link2 is transform that transforms a quantity expressed in link2 frame in a quantity expressed in the link1 frame, when the joint is in the 0 position : p_link1 = link1_T_link2*p_link2 .

briefdescription.para: Get the first link attached to the joint.
Get the second link attached to the joint.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: getRestTransform

briefdescription.para: Get the transform between the link parent and the link child at joint position 0 (or at the identity configuration element for complex joints).

detaileddescription.para: Such that: p_child = child_H_parent*p_parent where p_child is a quantity expressed in the child frame, and p_parent is a quantity expressed in the child frame.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: getTransform

briefdescription.para: Get the transform between the parent and the child, such that: p_child = child_H_parent*p_parent, where p_child is a quantity expressed in the child frame, and p_parent is a quantity expressed in the parent frame.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent, const int posCoord_i) const
memberdef.name: getTransformDerivative

briefdescription.para: Get the derivative of the transform with respect to a position coordinate.

detaileddescription.para: In particular, if the selected position coordinate is $q$, return the derivative: \[ \frac{\partial {}^\texttt{child} H_\texttt{parent} }{\partial q} \]
If posCoord_i is not >= 0 and < getNrOfPosCoords(), the returned value is undefined.

memberdef.argsstring: (int dof_i, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent=LINK_INVALID_INDEX) const
memberdef.name: getMotionSubspaceVector

briefdescription.para: Get the motion subspace vector corresponding to the i-th dof of the joint, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the i-th column of the motion subspace matrix. The motion subspace matrix is the matrix that maps the joint velocity to the relative twist between the two links.

In particular the motion subspace vector of the i-th dof is the S vector such that v_child = S_{child,parent}*dq_i + child_X_parent*v_parent if the velocities associated to all other DOFs of the joint are considered zero, where v_child and v_parent are the left-trivialized (body) velocities of the link child and parent.
See "Modelling, Estimation and Identification of Humanoid Robots Dynamics" Silvio Traversaro - Section 3.2 https://traversaro.github.io/preprints/traversaro-phd-thesis.pdf for more details.

the motion subspace vector.
If dof_i is not >= 0 and < getNrOfDOFs(), the returned value is undefined.

simplesect.para: The motion subspace matrix is also known in literature as hinge matrix, hinge map matrix, joint map matrix or joint motion map matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const VectorDynSize &jntVel, const VectorDynSize &jntAcc, LinkPositions &linkPositions, LinkVelArray &linkVels, LinkAccArray &linkAccs, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: computeChildPosVelAcc

briefdescription.para: Compute the position, velocity and acceleration of link child, given the position, velocty and acceleration of link parent and the joint position, velocity and acceleration.

detaileddescription.para: The position, velocity and acceleration of link child are directly saved in the linkPositions, linkVels and linkAccs arguments.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const VectorDynSize &jntVel, LinkVelArray &linkVels, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: computeChildVel

briefdescription.para: Compute the velocity of child, given the velocity of parent and the joint position, velocity.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const VectorDynSize &jntVel, const VectorDynSize &jntAcc, LinkVelArray &linkVels, LinkAccArray &linkAccs, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: computeChildVelAcc

briefdescription.para: Compute the velocity and acceleration of child, given the velocity and acceleration of parent and the joint position, velocity and acceleration.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const VectorDynSize &jntVel, const LinkVelArray &linkVels, const VectorDynSize &jntAcc, LinkAccArray &linkAccs, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: computeChildAcc

briefdescription.para: Compute the (body-fixed) acceleration of a child link given the (body-fixed) acceleration of the parent.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const VectorDynSize &jntVel, const LinkVelArray &linkVels, LinkAccArray &linkBiasAccs, const LinkIndex child, const LinkIndex parent) const
memberdef.name: computeChildBiasAcc

briefdescription.para: Compute the (body-fixed) bias acceleration of a child link given the (body-fixed) bias acceleration of the parent.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VectorDynSize &jntPos, const Wrench &internalWrench, const LinkIndex linkThatAppliesWrench, const LinkIndex linkOnWhichWrenchIsApplied, VectorDynSize &jntTorques) const
memberdef.name: computeJointTorque

briefdescription.para: Compute the internal torque of joint, given the internal wrench that the linkThatAppliesWrench applies on the linkOnWhichWrenchIsApplied, expressed in the link frame of the linkOnWhichWrenchIsApplied.

parameterdescription.para: internal wrench that the linkThatAppliesWrench applies on the linkOnWhichWrenchIsApplied, expressed in the link frame of the linkOnWhichWrenchIsApplied
link index of the link that applies the considered internal wrench.
link index of the link on which the considered internal wrench is applied.

briefdescription.para: Method to check if the joint has limits.

simplesect.para: true if the joints has limits

briefdescription.para: Method to set if the joint has limits.

simplesect.para: true if everything went correctly, false otherwise (for example if the joint does not support joint position limits)

briefdescription.para: Get min and max position limits of the joint, for the _index dof.

parameterdescription.para: index of the dof for which the limit are obtained.

simplesect.para: true if everything is correct, false otherwise.

Get the max position limit of the joint, bindings-friendly version.
Set the position limits for a dof the joint.

simplesect.para: This just sets the internal position limits of the joint. To set them as enabled, you need to call the enablePosLimits(true) method.

briefdescription.para: Method to get the specific joint dynamics type used for the joint.

simplesect.para: : It is assume that all the degrees of freedom of a joint share the same joint dynamics type.
the specific joint dynamics type used for the joint.

briefdescription.para: Method to get the specific joint dynamics type used for the joint.

simplesect.para: : It is assume that all the degrees of freedom of a joint share the same joint dynamics type.
true if everything went correctly, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set damping parameter of the joint, for the _index dof.

detaileddescription.para: The damping coefficient is expressed in N∙s/m for a prismatic joint, N∙m∙s/rad for a revolute joint.

This parameter is considered in the following joint dynamics types:
URDFJointDynamics

parameterdescription.para: index of the dof for which the dynamic parameters are obtained.

simplesect.para: true if everything is correct, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set static friction parameter of the joint, for the _index dof.

detaileddescription.para: The static friction coefficient is expressed in N for a prismatic joint, N∙m for a revolute joint.

This parameter is considered in the following joint dynamics types:
URDFJointDynamics

parameterdescription.para: index of the dof for which the dynamic parameters are obtained.

simplesect.para: true if everything is correct, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the damping coefficient of the joint.

detaileddescription.para: The unit is N∙s/m for a prismatic joint, N∙m∙s/rad for a revolute joint.

This parameter is considered in the following joint dynamics types:
URDFJointDynamics

briefdescription.para: Get the static friction coefficient of the joint.

detaileddescription.para: The unit is N for a prismatic joint, N∙m for a revolute joint.

This parameter is considered in the following joint dynamics types:
URDFJointDynamics

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::Span< const double > jntPos, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > &jac) const
memberdef.name: getPositionDerivativeVelocityJacobian

briefdescription.para: Get the getNrOfPosCoords() × getNrOfDOFs() matrix that maps the joint velocity to the derivative of the joint position.

detaileddescription.para:
This method computes the Jacobian matrix J such that: d/dt(q_pos) = J * q_vel where:
q_pos are the position coordinates of the joint (getNrOfPosCoords() elements)
q_vel are the velocity coordinates of the joint (getNrOfDOFs() elements)
J is the getNrOfPosCoords() × getNrOfDOFs() Jacobian matrix

For simple joints where position and velocity have the same parameterization, this is the identity matrix. For joints with different position and velocity parameterizations (e.g., SO(2) joints using complex numbers for position but angular velocity for DOF), this matrix encodes the relationship.

parameterdescription.para: Joint position coordinates (must have at least getNrOfPosCoords() elements)
The Jacobian matrix (must be properly sized)

simplesect.para: true if the computation was successful, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the position coordinates of the joint to the rest position (i.e zero for simple joints)

parameterdescription.para: full vector of model joint positions, of dimension Model::getNrOfPosCoords()

simplesect.para: true if the operation was successful, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Normalize the position coordinates of the joint in the specified joint positios vector.

detaileddescription.para: If the joint is using a minimal representation for the position coordinates, this method does not anything, but if the joint uses a constrained representation such as unit complex numbers of unit quaternions, this method normalizes the position coordinates, ensuring that one of the closest valid positiion coordinates is used.

parameterdescription.para: full vector of model joint positions, of dimension Model::getNrOfPosCoords()

simplesect.para: true if the operation was successful, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the joint center relative to the given link.

parameterdescription.para: vector from the link origin to the joint center, expressed in that link frame

briefdescription.para: Get the joint center relative to the given link.

simplesect.para: vector from the link origin to the joint center, expressed in that link frame

briefdescription.para: Class representing a spherical joint, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: a joint that constrains two links to have the same position but allows any relative orientation (3 rotational degrees of freedom).
The joint state is parameterized using a unit quaternion q = [qw, qx, qy, qz] (4 position coordinates), and the angular velocity ω expressed in the first link frame (3 velocity coordinates).
Note: The quaternion follows the real/imaginary (w,x,y,z) convention used by iDynTree, where w is the real part and (x,y,z) is the imaginary part.
The 6D spatial vectors (velocity, acceleration, forces) follow the linear/angular (linear first, angular second) convention used by iDynTree.
